resources.string: Blocks ad hosts, activities, views, splashscreens, services and recievers, without touching system hosts file nor using a VPN for blocking.
Block ad activities and views according to a preloaded list
Blocks ad url addresses and domains without touching system hosts
Block page elements according to a preloaded list
Block ad services according to a preloaded list
Block ad receivers according to a preloaded list
This module is distributed under GPL-3.0 license
View this project\'s source code or contribute on GitHub
Allow canceling any dialog (Useful when applications displays anti-ad dialogs)
Record more logs to provide debugging information
Hides XP-AdBlocker icon from launcher. You can still access settings via Xposed Manager.
Select which applications should be affected by XP-AdBlocker
Block activities that may contain a prefix or suffix related to Ads (Unstable! it may break some apps).
Discuss about this module on XDA
Input activities that should not be affected by this module
Ignores system apps either when blacklist or whitelist mode is enabled
Prevent selected apps from auto creating shortcuts
Improves performance, but every new configuration will not take effect until next boot
Block URL Addresses based on their paths
Enables XP-AdBlocker for all apps, except for apps selected in the App List, whose won\'t be affected.
This module is currently being developed by HSSkyBoy
Prevent some applications from attempting to block Xposed themselves
Prevent apps from showing splash screen according to a preloaded activity list
